alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Johnston; Nash; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 5:57PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Nash, east central Wake, north central Johnston and southeastern Franklin Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 557 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Zebulon, or 16 miles east of Raleigh, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Zebulon, Bunn, Wendell, Rolesville, Spring Hope, Middlesex and Pilot. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this storm. If the storm intensifies and rotation strengthens, a warning may need to be issued. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central North Carolina.
